conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible room volumes, and the ceiling/roof removed to reveal interiors.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion and cutaway; corners read as 3D. View is elevated/angled with minimal distortion; some walls/openings simplified.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall macro-zoning matches (living/kitchen left, master suite top-right, secondary bedrooms right, garage bottom-right). However, patios/covered patio areas are not represented as distinct spaces, and several partitions/door locations appear simplified or shifted.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofas, dining tables) and kitchen island/counters shown. Bathroom/utility fixtures are partially represented but simplified; some rooms have minimal or ambiguous fixture detail.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors and consistent materials. Lighting is adequate for layout comprehension; some openings/doorways are hard to distinguish due to simplification.

detected_errors.description: Exterior/patio areas from the 2D plan are largely omitted or not modeled as distinct spaces, reducing full layout fidelity.
Doors/windows are simplified; several door placements and opening proportions are not clearly matched to the 2D plan.
Some rooms (bath/utility/hall) have simplified or incomplete fixture/furnishing representation, making room identity less explicit.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall zoning and volumes, but with notable simplification/omission of patio/exterior spaces and some door/opening fidelity loss.
